title: Setting `snippetsPreventQuickSuggestions` is not considered
body:
> turn snippetsPreventQuickSuggestions to true and ensure typing in a snippet placeholder doesn't trigger quick suggestions

Does not work for me:

![Code_-_Insiders_XGunqwfNfA](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/2931520/b5465fdb-f125-40e2-8e20-983b58867a62)

_Originally posted by @hediet in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/173387#issuecomment-1571696644_

title: Diff editor verbosity setting name should be camelcased
body: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/eef30e7165e19b33daa1e15e92fa34ff4a5df0d3/src/vs/workbench/contrib/accessibility/browser/accessibilityContribution.ts#L12 Should this rather be ```ts DiffEditor = 'accessibility.verbosity.diffEditor', ```

title: `:` should be used instead of a `,` to punctuate chat response from code block count
body: I learned from Roberto Perez that using `:` in favor of `,` makes the pronunciation with some speech engines clearer.

title: Editor: Inline suggestion conflicts with meta+[ArrowRight]
body:
<!-- ‚ö†Ô∏è‚ö†Ô∏è Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ‚ö†Ô∏è‚ö†Ô∏è -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- üïÆ Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- üîé Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- üß™ Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- üí° Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- üîß Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
<!-- ü™ì If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- üì£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
Version: 1.78.2
Commit: b3e4e68a0bc097f0ae7907b217c1119af9e03435
Date: 2023-05-10T15:00:40.428Z
Electron: 22.5.2
Chromium: 108.0.5359.215
Node.js: 16.17.1
V8: 10.8.168.25-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 22.4.0
Sandboxed: Yes

- OS Version: macOS Ventura 13.3.1 (a) (22E772610a)

Steps to Reproduce:

0. Disable extensions: `$code --disable-extensions`
1. Enable Inline Suggestions (Editor ‚Ä∫ Inline Suggest)
2. Create JS file with the following contents:
```
const x = ''
console.log(x)
```
3. Delete second occurrence of 'x'  and reinsert 'x'.
4. Hit CMD + ARROW-RIGHT.
Expected: Cursor moves beyond closing ')' to EOL.
Actual: Cursor stays put just after 's'.

Workarounds: 
a) CMD + ARROW-LEFT than CMD + ARROW-RIGHT
b) Disable Inline Suggestions
c) Revert back to VSCode version 1.77.3

Keyboard Shortcuts Troubleshooting:

```
2023-05-31 09:32:22.077 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Soft dispatching keyboard event
2023-05-31 09:32:22.078 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ Keyboard event cannot be dispatched
2023-05-31 09:32:22.078 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Received  keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: MetaLeft, keyCode: 91, key: Meta
2023-05-31 09:32:22.078 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Converted keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: MetaLeft, keyCode: 57 ('Meta')
2023-05-31 09:32:22.079 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ Keyboard event cannot be dispatched in keydown phase.
2023-05-31 09:32:23.578 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Soft dispatching keyboard event
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Resolving meta+[ArrowRight]
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ From 3 keybinding entries, matched editor.action.inlineSuggest.acceptNextWord, when: inlineSuggestionVisible && !editorReadonly, source: built-in.
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Received  keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: ArrowRight, keyCode: 39, key: ArrowRight
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Converted keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: ArrowRight, keyCode: 17 ('RightArrow')
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Resolving meta+[ArrowRight]
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ From 3 keybinding entries, matched editor.action.inlineSuggest.acceptNextWord, when: inlineSuggestionVisible && !editorReadonly, source: built-in.
2023-05-31 09:32:23.580 [info] [KeybindingService]: + Invoking command editor.action.inlineSuggest.acceptNextWord.
2023-05-31 09:32:25.041 [info] [KeybindingService]: + Storing single modifier for possible chord meta.
2023-05-31 09:32:25.343 [info] [KeybindingService]: + Clearing single modifier due to 300ms elapsed.
```

title: TS move to existing file should open the file's cwd by default
body:
Testing #183683

1. Have a file and type in the file
2. "Move to file" and "Select an existing file"
3. The file explorer opens "recents" by default on Linux. I would expect it to be open to the directory where the current file is

title: Can't do regex search after opening notebook
body: - Open a notebook - I want to do a regex search in normal text files in my workspace, but the option is disabled This caught me off guard, I see that I have to disable searching in rendered markdown to enable regex mode, which makes sense, but I don't want to search in notebooks right now. Does it search in rendered markdown by default? One thing that would be helpful would be to have a tooltip to tell me _why_ regex search is disabled

title: `markdown.copyFiles.destination` variables not working?
body: Testing #183682 Not sure what's happening, but none of the "document" variables work for me. Example That is pasted as this So it saw "images" but not the second component. All of the other "document" variables are ignored similarly

title: `markdown.copyFiles.destination` doesn't escape markdown characters in path
body:
Testing #183682

Set the value to `abc)/${fileName}`. This is a valid path, but the `)` does not get escaped in the markdown link.

title: Empty value in markdown.copyFiles.destination sends the image to the parent directory
body:
Testing #183682

When I set up the `markdown.copyFiles.destination` setting, but leave the value empty, the image goes to the parent directory of the workspace folder, which seems unexpected. I think I would want it to keep the default behavior of going next to the markdown file. Just testing this because settings like this are often confusing so I think it should have good failure modes.

title: Additional details not rendered for embedder builtin extensions
body:
1. Open extension details page for GitHub Repositories extension in insiders.vscode.dev
2. :bug: the marketplace and repository links aren't shown
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/30305945/c925ff4a-2b3b-4308-925e-03d8e5cb8faf)

title: TreeCheckboxChangeEvent: doc comment should say `items`
body:
Testing #183549
```
		/**
		* The item that was checked or unchecked.
		*/
		readonly items: ReadonlyArray<[T, TreeItemCheckboxState]>;
```

As the event can list multiple items, the  doc comment should say `items`

title: Markdown settings typo: "part of in a workspace"
body: Testing #183682 of vs. in, currently using both: "if the file is not part of in a workspace."

title: Do not allow moving to the same file
body:
Testing #183683

- Open a TS file and select a class symbol -> Refactor... -> Move to File... > Select Existing File
- Select the same file
üêõ Symbol gets moved inside the same file

title: Switching profile works even if it has to be blocked
body:
Testing #183534

- Open a folder that has a image in an empty profile say T1
- Install Luna Paint Extension
- Edit the image using Luna Paint and do not save
- Switch the profile to another profile say T2
- A dialog is shown ‚úÖ  and press OK
- Reload window

üêõ Profile is switched
